text: The voiced velar implosive is a type of consonantal sound, used in some spoken languages. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is , and the equivalent X-SAMPA symbol is `g_<`. It is familiar to English speakers as the sound made when mimicking the 'gulping' of water. ==Features== ===Occurrence=== {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2| Language !! Word !! IPA !! Meaning !! Notes |- |colspan=2| Af Maay || || || 'pen' || Corresponds to /q/ in Standard Somali |- |colspan=2| Ega ||colspan=2 align=center| || 'count' || |- |colspan=2| Fula || || || || |- |colspan=2| Jamaican || || || 'good' || Allophone of in the onset of prominent syllables |- |colspan=2| Sindhi || || || 'cow' || |- |colspan=2| Tera || || || '(a greeting)' || |- |colspan=2| Zulu || || || 'to come' || Allophone of |} ==See also== * List of phonetics topics * Voiceless velar implosive ==Notes== ==References== * * * * ==External links== * Category:Implosives Category:Central consonants Category:Voiced oral consonants
title: Voiced velar implosive
